ðŸ’¡ wechat2tg | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Bridging communication between WeChat and Telegram for users who want to manage messages from both platforms in one place.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Receive messages from WeChat (personal chats, group chats, official accounts, enterprise WeChat) â€¢ Send messages via Telegram to specific WeChat users, groups, and official accounts â€¢ Flexible group message blocking functionality
ðŸ“– Summary: The wechat2tg repository facilitates message transmission between WeChat and Telegram. It supports various WeChat protocols and enables users to receive and send messages across platforms, including text, images, videos, and files, with some limitations on specific message types like red packets and mini programs.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ’¡ sbv | JavaScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Viewing and managing SMS, MMS, and call log backups from Android devices.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Multi-user support â€¢ Import SMS Backup & Restore XML files â€¢ Idempotent imports â€¢ Support for large backups â€¢ SMS, MMS, and call logs support
ðŸ“– Summary: SMS Backup Viewer (SBV) is a web application for viewing SMS and MMS message backups from "SMS Backup & Restore" XML files. It allows users to import and browse their messages in a texting app-like interface, supporting features like multi-user access, media preview, and full-text search.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ chrome-devtools-mcp | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Enabling coding agents to control and inspect a Chrome browser for automation, debugging, and performance analysis.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Get performance insights using Chrome DevTools to record traces and extract actionable performance insights.
ðŸ“– Summary: The `chrome-devtools-mcp` repository provides a Model-Context-Protocol (MCP) server that allows coding agents (like Gemini or Copilot) to control and inspect a live Chrome browser. It leverages Chrome DevTools and Puppeteer to enable reliable automation, in-depth debugging, and performance analysis for AI coding assistants.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸŒŸ zoxide | Rust
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Faster and more efficient navigation of the file system in the command line.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Smarter directory jumping based on frequency of use â€¢ Fuzzy matching of directory names â€¢ Interactive selection using fzf â€¢ Shell completions (bash, fish, zsh) â€¢ Works like a regular cd command
ðŸ“– Summary: Zoxide is a smarter `cd` command that remembers frequently used directories, allowing users to quickly "jump" to them using a few keystrokes. It is inspired by z and autojump and supports all major shells.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ 3xui-shopbot | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Automated sales and management of VLESS VPN configurations via Telegram.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Automated registration and key delivery â€¢ Web panel for server, tariff, user, payment, log, and speedtest management â€¢ Multi-host support for multiple 3x-ui servers â€¢ Flexible tariff configuration â€¢ Payment gateway integrations (YooKassa, CryptoBot, Heleket, TON Connect)
ðŸ“– Summary: The 3xui-shopbot is a Python-based Telegram bot designed for automated sales of VLESS configurations, deeply integrated with the 3x-ui panel. It offers a comprehensive solution for managing VPN subscriptions, payments, and user access through a web panel built on Tabler.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source
